item.title: Getting `any` and `all` functionality in SAS
item.description: Get the functionality of any and all(from R) in SAS One way of doing this within PROC SQL is to use the min and max functions: PROC SQL; SELECT sex, min(age < 18) as allMinors FROM sashelp.classes GROUP BY sex; SELECT sex, max(height >= 6*12) as someBBallHope FROM sashelp.classes GROUP BY sex; QUIT; would correspond to library(tidyverse) classes %>% group_by(sex) %>% summarise(allMinors = all(age < 18)) classes %>% group_by(sex) %>% summarise(someBBallHope = any(height >= 6*12))

item.title: About
item.description: This is a “hello world” example website for the blogdown package. The theme was forked from @jrutheiser/hugo-lithium-theme and modified by Yihui Xie.
